title: If your auto attack goes off but you die before it hits
body:
It should still hit.

It makes 0 sense that just because you die a projectile disappears from the map.

replies.body: You have to understand the projectile is only an animation of the attack timing, and not an actual object in game.  An attack takes x amount of time to "hit".  If you die before that time, regardless what the animation looks like, a hit is not scored.

Upvoted you. I think the OP is pointing out that it doesn't make sense. If I fire an arrow from a bow in real life, even if I get deleted, the arrow still keeps flying and eventually hits something. Why wouldn't this be the case in LoL too? Does it make sense for the Turrets giant lazor bomb attack to do no damage if you destroy the tower while the attack is mid air? 

I don't know! I kind of agree with the OP, but it would cause a ginormous re-coding headache for Riot to change this.

And flash shouldn't stop projectiles. (Btw, that's sarcasm.)

1 for 1 trades are never worth it.

Here is the problem, there is no good way to code the game so that this happens while also keeping in auto-attack stalling. The function they are using is on a delay based on the champion's animation. Most likely the function for that projectile animation occurs before the one to deal damage. I say this based on the fact that sometimes if you time it correctly, you can cancel the animation after the projectile and before the damage. 

Meaning that the damage of an auto attack is based on the function which the animation of that champion model is attached to, not the projectile animation itself. 

Now consider if they were to reverse this and attach the damage function onto the projectile animation, first this would probably be much harder to optimize, but more importantly in terms of gameplay it would mean that a person who was very quick at clicking could start an auto attack, cancel it, and fire again, artificially increasing their attack speed if timed correctly.

I'm aware that this is how does work. The "projectile" of a ranged auto is really just part of the champions model. But it _should_ be coded as an actual projectile. For example, if you Q as ezreal then die your Q still goes off and can hit people. Ranged autos should work the same way.

Thanks for teaching me something tonight. And that means it makes even less sense.
Do target skills like Ryze's Q work like AA or like spells?

Ok let me make this clear, the projectile of the auto attack isn't coded as an object. It's a function on the animation of the champion. An ezreal Q, draven ult, Ashe volley, exc, exc. Are independent objects of the champion models, meaning they will continue to fly if the champion object is removed. That said, one of the big reasons to not do this would be that each auto attack is then an object and if you put to many objects on a screen at a single time it causes rendering lag, which is some people can have issues with their frame rate when a team fight breaks out and everyone uses their abilities at the same time. 

Changing auto attacks to objects would only compound such issues.

I have to admit. that's a very good concern.  I guess I understand what thye meant when they said they "had to summon some code wizardry to make Yasuo's shield destroy all projectiles".
Altought, in this case, I think "resolving" AA on death would make it a lot cleaner. (or turning it into a real projectile at that point)


Another point, does that mean there can't be 2 AA at the same time on screen? What happens if tristana with max AS is firing at max range?

I actually don't know about this, it'd have to be tested. Depending on how it's coded either one of two things will most likely happen in such a scenario. 
1) two auto attacks can be in flight at the same time, if the animation is a set speed and can have the same function run multiple times.
2) the actual run time of the auto attack animation is a dependent variable based on the champion's range and their auto attack speed. Meaning that the animation (or the bullet speed) will actually get faster if you increase the range and attack speed of the champion, as to avoid overlapping animations.

That said, from memory i don't remember ever seeing multiple auto-attacks, even from trist, at the same time, but that could be wrong.
It depends on when in the animation it occurs -- as Quinn mains can tell you, sometimes an attack can still be cancelled even if it's in flight.
Which is completely stupid. That shouldn't happen. If an attack has already left you it shouldn't matter what you do then. It should still hit.

To be fair, they weren't a multi-milion when they coded this (probably). 
But yeah, +1.
for too long, too many times i watched my lucian q go off right on top of the enemy champion only to do no damage cause i died a split second before.
This too needs to be fixed. In general, if any type of projectile attack is started, it should continue even if the player dies.

They can't do that without giving a rather obnoxious advantage for ranged over melees cos by that logic, if {{champion:91}} dies before landing the AA even though he started it, his AA will not continue.
For this it's simply a case of "suspension of disbelief"

That's the difference between ranged and melee. An AA from a melee hits when the animation is complete. The AA from a melee still does the same animation as well, but the projectile has to fly and hit the target. If anything, the way things are right now actually have melee champs at an advantage over ranged. The both have to go through the animation, but melee champs are ALWAYS instant. For a ranged champ, it will never be instant unless you're in melee range anyways. Both can be killed DURING the animation, but the projectile shouldn't just up and vanish if a ranged AA champ has already completed the animation, but it doesn't count if they die since the projectile hasn't hit yet. 

Essentially, if melee complete their animation, the hit goes through. If ranged complete their animation, they need to dance until the projectile actually hits or it vanishes into oblivion.

But thats changing the variables, the fact is if BOTH of them have the animation CANCELLED BY DEATH, using the logic of MY ARROWS ARE STILL IN FLIGHT THEREFORE AA LANDS, the melee ones WILL NEVER HIT because they WILL NOT CONTINUE ONCE THE USER DIES. 

(you are saying the melee one goes through then he dies, and comparing that to ranged dies before it goes through, unfair comparison)

You misunderstand. I said that if they are both killed during the animation, then yeah. Neither should hit. What I said, along with the OP, is that even if the ranged AA completes the animation, it's all for nothing if they die before the projectile hits because it magically vanishes like a fart in the wind.

If they both die during animation, then yeah. Nothing should happen. The thing that is unfair is that for melee, once the animation is complete it is a guaranteed hit. The ranged can complete the animation, but their AA can be canceled if they die before the projectile even reaches the target. 

Melee currently has a much more reliable AA since it's instant with the animation being completed. Ranged has an extra factor in it WITH their animation. Their animation and then having to wait until the projectile hits. All we're saying is that it's silly that if the character dies, that projectile after the champ's animation is already done and it vanishes into nothing if it doesn't hit the target before they die.

Think of it like this. Kill melee during animation, they failed their AA. Kill a ranged during their animation OR before the projectile hits you(even though they completed the animation and can move/use another skill), they failed their AA.
To help illustrate what Wirius is saying, go play twitch. You can literally animation cancel AFTER your shot hit. At least on gangster Twitch.

Not even dying, it's so dumb that you can watch the auto attack projectile fire, move, then have it be canceled mid air. Not sure why Riot thinks this is good design.

Altought, they should probably have resolved the AA on death. It probably complexifies skills like Yasuo's windwall, something that was non-existent when that decision was made.

But sorry, I can completely see why it is good design. Not completely well implemented, but good idea.

I never noticed that with ranged auto attacks, but I did notice the event when a turret projectile is in the air and the turret dies, the projectile doesn't hit. It would take some getting used to, but this really should not happen. It should still hit even if it dies, but not if you flash out.

I also think flash should be able to avoid projectiles (most, not all) unless it is locked on somehow, but that's kind of a different story. It's kind of stupid when a turret fires at me 10 milliseconds before I flash out of range and it still hits me. Some abilities/projectiles should lock on regardless of flash, but definitely not all.

Maybe restrict abilities that autolock during flash to ultimates, or certain abilities that specify 'homing even during flash', like Veigar's Ult still hitting you when you flash out seems fair, because it's powerful magic and an ultimate. But some weaker/non ultimate abilities like Kayle's Q (the slow) should not hit if someone flashes out, but it still does. Since flash has such a long cooldown it's not like this would imbalance the game much. If your reflexes are quick enough to flash out before a projectile (nonultimate) hits you, it feels unfair that it still hits you. 

Flash should also DEFINITELY cancel out minion attacks that are following you. It's really annoying when I barely escaped a big battle by flashing out and I die 3 seconds later because minion projectiles followed me underground  50 feet away, and the enemies get full credit for the kill.

But then you'd probably be pretty damn salty when you kill a melee champion, but their dead body somehow persuaded your HP to lower a bit (resulting in your death) because their animation started up already.
